scene_illustrations.rationale: This scene introduces the main characters and the inciting moment of wonder, with strong visual contrast between the calm riverbank and the sudden motion of the White Rabbit.
The prolonged fall down the well provides rich imaginative imagery with floating objects and an unusual sense of space, reinforcing the dreamlike tone of the chapter.
This scene establishes the central visual motif of scale and longing, contrasting the dark hall with the bright garden and clearly conveying Alice’s predicament.

consistency_rules: Alice’s appearance must remain visually consistent across all scenes, aside from scale changes explicitly shown by the environment.
The illustration style must remain painterly and storybook-like, avoiding sharp lines or modern visual elements.
Lighting should reflect the mood of each scene while maintaining a soft, child-appropriate tone.
Background elements should enhance the sense of wonder without obscuring the characters.
